intro: Oxytropis rydbergii, commonly known as the Rydberg's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and can be found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Oxytropis rydbergii is often used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils.
